607db84ab5811bd7417dd49e.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 200+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. This is made possible, in part, by an engineering organization that enables our customers to stream content and our studio to produce content. 

The Security Services Engineering organization supports these engineers at Netflix by creating and operating authentication, authorization, and cryptographic software services. The teams in this organization operate at the intersection of software engineering, privacy, and security expertise. The Auth Services team is responsible for the enforcement layers of authentication and authorization policy; creating high availability, low latency, and high throughput services, that are critical to the Netflix ecosystem and the Security Paved Road. 
 
The Role 
As the engineering manager for the Auth Services team, you’ll be responsible for a team of high caliber security software engineers driving vision and direction for some of our most critical services. You enjoy giving and receiving feedback and will support your team to succeed and grow through candid mentorship and coaching. The role is highly cross functional, and you’ll help your team solve the right problems by sharing business and technical context derived from the partnerships you will build with key stakeholders.

If you are curious about some of the team’s work, you can watch this Building Identity for an Open Perimeter conference talk by our IAM engineers and this panel about Security Paved Road at Netflix.

What you’ll need to be successful:

  • You are a pragmatic security leader who believes in risk focused, scalable security approaches with a strong technical background in developing low latency, high resiliency, and high-availability, services. 
  • You have excellent communication skills and a product focused mindset to build the right solutions for your stakeholders and customers. 
  • Deep care for creating a team which models psychological safety and inclusivity, where team members can do their best work.
  • You prefer collaboration and problem solving over process and mandates.  
  • You are comfortable dealing with ambiguity and independent decision making.
  • You have experience leading, hiring, coaching and cultivating an excellent team.
  • Ability to prioritize your team’s investments to align with broad business goals and risk-based security initiatives.
  • Well versed in identity and access management concepts.

606f38feb5811b7d92a1f1d9.description:
Netflix has a goal to entertain the world, touching the lives of individuals all over the globe. To enable this goal, we use cutting edge technology and techniques to enable streaming of content to more than 200 million member households globally, across thousands of different devices.

The JVM Ecosystem Team is a newly formed team within Java Platform - the centralized team for backend application development across all of Netflix, and is part of the Developer Productivity organization enabling the underlying technology and best practices for engineering at Netflix. We work to provide Netflix developers the best support, solutions, and practices to leverage common centralized needs.

This role is to help shape and guide the vision for the Java Ecosystem Team, whose primary goal is to enable a simple, performant, and seamless development experience for JVM developers at Netflix.

This is an exciting opportunity to help shape the future of JVM usage across Netflix’s microservice fleet, optimizing and tailoring the technology to business and developer needs. We are looking for an outstanding leader to help drive the future vision of our JVM ecosystem!

What you will be responsible for managing

  • Application build process (Gradle)
  • Optimizing for JVM performance and configuration needs across the different user profiles
  • Build artifact management, including Library SDLC
  • JDK ownership - vendor relationship, LTS upgrades, new functionality
  • Insight and tooling for JVM applications

What skills you should be applying to the role

  • Minimum 2 years experience growing a strong and diverse technical team with a fun working culture.
  • Helping to build the team identity and vision for a team of strong Senior Engineers, promoting IC (Individual Contributor) decision-making, while make decisions when needed.
  • Able to comfortably navigate the ambiguity of a wide range of customer and partner needs, working to create the best products for the business priorities.
  • Coaching and development of senior engineers to enable continued growth.
  • Picking up different hats as needed for the team, including project and product management.

What skills would be nice to bring along

  • Deep JVM knowledge
  • Gradle / build management experience
  • Dependency management expertise

60805694b5811b69627dd116.description:
Netflix is reinventing how the world watches television. Over 200 million members around the globe enjoy our award-winning movies and TV shows, but most of our growth still lies ahead. Content Engineering is in a hyper-growth phase as Netflix continues to expand its content budget.

About the team
The Promotional Media Management Engineering (PMM) team is responsible for the digital asset management of our promotional assets for a growing number of titles with constantly evolving asset suites. The products and services on this team ensure that our promotional assets are discoverable, trackable, measurable, and reusable. 

About the role
The Promotional Media Management Engineering team is hiring a seasoned leader to drive Promotional Media Engineering’s most impactful projects. PMM is responsible for building products and services that enable us to manage the complete lifecycle of all our promotional assets. This team works closely with Product Management, Design, Analytics, UI and various business teams to define and implement strategies to optimize the cost and on time delivery of assets. 

About the space
Promotional assets are the key to discovering content you love to watch. The Promotional Media Engineering products make it easy to tell stories about our stories. We build products to get artwork and video assets in front of our members, both on and off-service. Our backend services power products that are used internally at Netflix as well as externally by our content partners,  fulfillment partners, creative agencies and freelancers that work with Netflix to curate one of the best entertainment catalogs in the world. 

What you’ll do:

  • Team Leadership: build and lead a team of server-side engineers adept at building distributed microservices.
  • Technical Vision: re-evaluate architecture choices on an ongoing basis, in anticipation of increased scale and ever-evolving technology to meet the demands of a growing business.
  • Demonstrate technical skills to successfully drive infrastructure & tool improvements for new products and existing processes and workflows
  • Product Leadership: define and execute the roadmap by collaborating with partners in Product, Design and Operations.
  • Build and lead an inclusive team of great engineers from different backgrounds, cultures, industries and life experiences.

Qualifications:

  • You have experience building and leading a team of server side engineers.
  • You are an innovative thinker and are comfortable pushing your own team to continue to push boundaries.
  • Track record of managing large successful teams and invest in actively mentoring and coaching every member of the team.
  • Ability to work through ambiguous requirements and make decisions to push forward. 
  • You are passionate about building highly scalable solutions with flexibility factored in to make quick pivots as business evolves.
  • Experience working with a product team to build a vision for how UX, UI, and the back-end will come together on a given product or features.
  • You have proven skills in building software systems in a distributed / cloud environment, deployed in a CI/CD fashion.

What Sets You Apart

  • You have worked on horizontal platforms/products that serve multiple engineering teams.
  • Great communication and collaboration skills working cross-functionally with multiple teams.

604ee785aabfb451ecf82656.description:
About Netflix:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with 200+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching  all without commercials or commitments. We are revolutionizing how shows and movies are produced, pushing technological boundaries to efficiently deliver streaming video at a massive scale over the internet. We are focused on disrupting the media and entertainment industry by applying innovative software development and data design practices.

The storage platform team has the primary charter to deliver storage and transport products that provide file and directory access to applications and users around the globe which is performant, secure, and centrally managed. This platform is a foundational building block to multiple studio engineering products.

The Role
We are looking for a seasoned leader for the storage platform team who is passionate about leading, coaching, hiring, aligning, and delivering critical storage solutions for the business. This is a cross-functional role where you will partner, collaborate and align with the platform, studio, product, and business teams. The scope and impact of the team are rapidly evolving and growing which will provide opportunities to evolve and grow the team in innovative ways.

Who Are You?

  • You are curious, enjoy hard technical problems, and are driven by big impact.
  • You are experienced in hiring, leading, coaching, and growing teams across different skills and traits.
  • You enjoy collaborating across cross-functional teams and connecting the dots.
  • You are a clear, proactive communicator with good written and verbal skills. 
  • You build trust and are capable of debating and understanding different perspectives but always be driven by making the right decisions for the business.
  • You lead the team with context and provide the guard rails for technical architecture, product vision, project execution, and production operations.

What (ideally) you already know or have experience in

  • Storage technologies like FUSE (File system in user space), File systems, Block storage, Object storage.
  • Platform development and operational experience in cloud infrastructures.
  • Delivered cross-functional complex products across multiple teams.
  • Building a team of stunning colleagues via hiring, coaching, context, feedback, and accountability.
  • Working through quickly evolving business requirements and multiple stakeholders.
We are inclusive and our culture is unique. We tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.

This is a cross-functional role where you will partner, collaborate and align with the platform, studio, product, and business teams. The scope and impact of the team are rapidly evolving and growing which will provide opportunities to evolve and grow the team in innovative ways. Who Are You?
  • You are curious, enjoy hard technical problems, and are driven by big impact.
  • You are experienced in hiring, leading, coaching, and growing teams across different skills and traits.
  • You enjoy collaborating across cross-functional teams and connecting the dots.
  • You are a clear, proactive communicator with good written and verbal skills. 
  • You build trust and are capable of debating and understanding different perspectives but always be driven by making the right decisions for the business.
  • You lead the team with context and provide the guard rails for technical architecture, product vision, project execution, and production operations.
    • What (ideally) you already know or have experience in
  • Storage technologies like FUSE (File system in user space), File systems, Block storage, Object storage.
  • Platform development and operational experience in cloud infrastructures.
  • Delivered cross-functional complex products across multiple teams.
  • Building a team of stunning colleagues via hiring, coaching, context, feedback, and accountability.
  • Working through quickly evolving business requirements and multiple stakeholders.

60959d7b3d6b6240ca992c9a.description:
As Netflix continues to grow, we are venturing into exciting new frontiers that help our members find the content they’ll most enjoy. At the core of all this innovation is reliable, high-quality data which fuels progress in the form of new user experiences and personalization.

Netflix is looking for a seasoned engineering leader to head the Product Analytics Data Engineering team. Your team of software and data engineers will directly interact with product managers and analytics leaders to identify product opportunities. We do this by building big data pipelines and services using Spark, Flink, Druid, Cassandra, Presto, and other distributed computing tools. This is an opportunity to lead and grow a team of world class engineers who build smart & interactive analytical apps and aggregate & curate the largest datasets at Netflix.

To be successful in this role, you need to be a strong people manager; great at giving and receiving feedback, fostering new ideas, and empowering others. You also need a strong software engineering background, to be a quick and data-driven learner, to have proven data engineering and system design skills, and the ability to lead large multi-disciplinary, cross-functional teams.

Responsibilities:

  • Recruiting: You are constantly on the lookout for talent and have a knack for recognizing and attracting top-tier engineers to your team. You understand the importance of building an amazing team and the value it brings to the overall company.
  • Feedback & Development: You will coach and guide employees through their strengths and weaknesses through regular feedback.
  • Contribute to Data Science & Engineering Leadership: You will be expected to participate in leadership conversations and interview for engineering teams across Netflix.
  • Vision: You intuitively understand business, analytics, and technology, and you leverage that to guide a team by providing relevant context and inspiration.
  • Partnership: You will continue to establish strong relationships with both business and technical leaders across Netflix.

Skills & Characteristics:

  • You are a natural people leader who also demonstrates humility. You care deeply about people, and their success. You invest in your relationships, so that you have an understanding of the whole person and their perspective.
  • You’re not afraid of hard conversations, and are gifted at coaching your colleagues through difficult situations. You are comfortable sharing your perspective on challenging people dynamics.
  • You seek to de-escalate tense situations, and are creative & flexible in finding balance with partners to maximize impact.
  • You are a strong communicator, and self-aware about how others perceive your comments. As someone in a leadership role you aim to be assertive, not passive nor aggressive, in providing input, support, and feedback.
  • You are forward-looking and able to anticipate the investments Netflix should be making to improve efficiency, innovation, and alignment. You identify areas for continuous improvement, and persistently advocate for action to address them.
  • You have an impeccable eye for technical talent, and a history of influencing hiring decisions across organizations. In this role you will be expected to understand how the Data Science & Engineering organization’s broad hiring strategy translates into the needs of our team, and our partners.
  • You’re allergic to micromanagement. You prefer to give context, delegate, and watch amazing people exceed your hopes and expectations.
  • You work hard, and you have healthy boundaries. You know how to prioritize both your work and personal commitments without set boundaries or guidelines.

Preferred Requirements:

  • You have 10+ years software development experience. You have a mastery of object-oriented design and design patterns, and programming skills.
  • You have 5+ years of engineering team management experience.
  • You have a MS in Computer Science/Engineering, or related field.
  • You have used big data technologies (i.e. Spark/MapReduce/Hadoop, etc.) at one point in your career, and have built web-scale data pipelines.
  • You have used SQL and reporting tools at one point in your career, and are analytically savvy.

Two more things to know:

  • Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about it at https://jobs.netflix.com/culture. 
  • We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

6066b5457a9df86d8104a1f4.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service, with 200+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across various genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

The Detection and Response team at Netflix is a central security team that gathers security intelligence, responds to security incidents, and looks for attacker activity in our environment. You will lead a full-cycle security incident response program starting from identification to containment to mitigation. We are looking for a leader to scale and mature the incident response function through automation and promulgation of incident management best practices. 

The person in this role will own, build, and advance our incident response charter, including studio incident response and an insider threat program. You will closely collaborate with many other Netflix teams to actively defend Netflix’s assets across streaming, studio, and enterprise. This is an active and highly visible role that requires an appreciation for operational excellence and a solid ability to build cross-functional relationships. You will mentor people and encourage their personal and organizational growth in line with Netflix’s values. 

Desired skills and background:

  • You are a meticulous and responsive cross-team communicator and program leader.
  • Your technical background aligns with the current team operating at the intersection of software engineering, incident response, and digital forensics.
  • You are well versed in the latest adversary techniques, attack lifecycle, and incident response procedure.
  • As a manager, you can successfully coach and inspire a talented and senior team.
  • You creatively scale Incident Response Program with an emphasis on automation, testing, and training.
  • You lead with influence. 
  • You are confident in working with frontline teammates, executives, third-party organizations, and everyone in between to aggregate information and coordinate collaborative action.
Netflix Security Incident Response Team has often shared our work with the broader security community. We encourage you to learn more about us by reading about our open-source projects (Dispatch for crisis management) and conference talks (Reservist talk at USENIX Enigma and Learning from cloud, chaos, and Scale: Netflix SIRT talk at the FIRST Conference).

The Netflix culture permeates our work environment. It determines who we hire, how we work together, and how we make decisions. It encourages us to bring our best every day while valuing collaboration over individual achievement. If this sounds exciting to you, we encourage you to apply today so that we can learn more about each other.

604b09477a9df8979a474c9c.text: Engineering Manager, Data Platform Edge API Infrastructure
604b09477a9df8979a474c9c.description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet TV network and we strive to bring engaging stories from many cultures to people all across the globe. With over 200 million members globally, Netflix depends on the data platform to provide the foundation for all of our product decisions - decisions that directly impact our customer experience. 

Our platform runs tens of thousands of jobs and processes over a trillion events a day. We support over a thousand data analysts, data scientists, and engineers across the company to make business decisions. Having excellent reliability for such a large and distributed cloud infrastructure is paramount to a data-driven company like Netflix.  

This team is building an API gateway and clients to unify access to Netflix's data platform and provide a consistent entry point making it easy and efficient for any data consumers. The API exposes a single GraphQL endpoint that expresses relationships between several discrete data platform entities and provides a query language that allows selective and efficient data retrieval with a strongly typed schema focusing on documentation and discoverability. When building a gateway, some of the challenges include maintaining consistency and development velocity while also balancing dimensions like scalability and operability. 

We are looking for an experienced engineering leader to realize the vision for the data platform edge, to help evolve our operations practices, and to build infrastructure to support our continued scaling for global expansion and our shift into more advanced support for machine learning and stream processing. 

Specifically, you and your team will

  • Drive the on-going vision of how users will interact with the data platform. 
  • Build systems and services to continuously improve how we qualify systems failures and quantify systems health. 
  • Partner with the rest of the data platform team to drive our vision towards a ‘data-driven’ data platform.
  • Evangelize operational best practices and continuously look for opportunities to automate and build tools to lower operational barriers, improve clarity on problematic areas, and improve reliability.
  • Lead and grow a team of top-talent senior software engineers. 

About you:

  • You have experience in building and leading distributed teams of senior engineers, and with helping your team members reach their potential.
  • You have experience in building and managing large scale distributed microservices that are shared across teams.
  • You are a strong partner and enjoy driving cross-functional, cross-team projects forward.
  • You are great at strategizing vision, evolving roadmaps based on changing business needs and motivating teams to execute on them. 
  • You are a people leader and a strong technical leader.
  • You have a passion for building and motivating teams to reach their potential.
  • You have experience building internal infrastructure that is shared across teams.
  • You are excited to be leading a team that is fundamental to the success of Netflix and making a big difference in revolutionizing internet TV!

605a535caabfb42f97f821cb.text: Engineering Manager, Big Data Warehouse and Data Governance Services
605a535caabfb42f97f821cb.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by creating content people love and bringing joy to people around the world. 

As Netflix continues to innovate on its product and grow its member base, we also have a strategic goal to build a globally connected and data-informed studio that can manage hundreds of productions simultaneously. The scale and challenges of integrating production and studio data with the product data are unprecedented in the industry. 

In this mission, the data platform is at the core of Netflix’s success. The big data warehouse team is part of the data platform team. It is responsible for two key missions. We aspire to build an intelligent big data warehouse that works like a product to abstract the details of managing large datasets typically needed from its users in a large-scale big data environment. We are also building a coherent data strategy across Netflix. We are in the midst of devising the long term strategy and roadmap for our cross-organizational data governance initiatives. Here is the team's charter that has more details on the missions of this team. 

We are looking for a strong leader to make a big impact on both of these fronts. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive team to bring new perspectives as we solve the next set of challenges. In addition, we are open to remote candidates. We value what you can do, from anywhere in the US. 

Specifically, you will:

  • Drive the vision, evolution, and innovation of the intelligent big data warehouse and data governance initiatives.
  • Collaborating with all leaders in the data platform team and partners’ organizations to define the right scope in which to deliver the right product at the right time.
  • Be a technical advisor working alongside the team to build a cohesive ecosystem of systems/services to advance the team charter.
  • Lead and grow an inclusive and high-performing team where everyone can contribute and make a difference to the team’s mission. 
  • Helping and enabling engineers to grow and flourish in a relatively flat engineering organization. 

You find joy and have experience in:

  • Collaborating with partners to strategize, crystalize and build long-term roadmaps for ambiguous business needs. 
  • Leading cross functional and cross team projects and bringing it to successful completion.
  • Building and operating large-scale distributed services for use by other teams; ideally with experience in cloud-based platforms.
  • Building and leading a team of engineers; ideally with experience leading remote employees. Understanding team needs and learning new approaches to increase representation through additive hiring.
  • Exercising strong judgment and making thoughtful decisions with ambiguous situations. Striking the right balance between providing context vs. giving direction. Trading off short-term wins vs. long-term success based on various constraints. 
Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility and the accountability to do the right thing for Netflix. Read more about the Netflix culture here.

605a47b23d6b6258c795b873.text: Engineering Manager, Studio Tech Solutions - Creative Production & Promotion
605a47b23d6b6258c795b873.description:
As one of the largest content producers, Netflix Studio earned the most Emmy nominations and produced more films than any other studio. For the studio to continue to scale and produce quality content, various business teams in the Studio, Marketing, and Creative production work closely with Product partners to innovate and develop applications to support the studio operations.

In the role of Engineering Manager of Studio Tech Solutions - Creative Production & Promotion, you will be building and leading a group of Sr. Software Engineers focusing on understanding business users’ use cases and developing prototypes, short-term and technical solutions for the Marketing and Creative Production org. The partnership with the product management, other engineering teams, and information security is equally important to stay highly aligned in addressing the Marketing & Creative Production org’s technology needs.

With a strong background in software development in distributed systems architecture, you will provide technical guidance and inspire the team to make the best judgment around engineering practices as well as implementation directions. 

You belong in this team if:

  • You are motivated to build a well-balanced, high-performing team by hiring top-talents with various experiences and backgrounds.
  • You are comfortable with driving high aligned goals and strategies with the business on project prioritization and roadmaps.
  • You build a strong partnership with Product Management, Data Platform Engineering, and Content Engineering by collaborating effectively & selflessly.
  • You are passionate about solving problems and willing to provide technical solutions at all levels of complexity (Spreadsheet to the custom app) and drive business impact.
  • You find fast-paced, high-impact projects more intriguing than the long-term, well-defined projects.
  • You are excited about getting familiar with the available Netflix engineering resources and paved path tools and providing development guidance to the team based on the learnings.
  • You enjoy mentoring and motivating team members to follow the best engineering practices and seek personal & technical growth opportunities.
  • You are committed to collaborating and strategizing with peers to optimize inefficiencies in communication and solution implementation practices.

Qualifications:

  • 8-9 years of experience in full-stack development including 4+ years of proven hands-on management experience of building & leading a talented group of developers.
  • Familiar with React and at least one of the following: Python, Nodejs, Java 
  • Experience in cloud-based deployments
  • Passionate about problem-solving and working with engineering and non-engineering partners.
  • Ability to translate technical concepts into languages that the audience (business stakeholders and engineering partners) with various levels of technical background can understand to influence decision making. 

Bonus if you have experience with:

  • Google G Suite APIs
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Building a relationship with the studio/marketing business users

  • Passionate about problem-solving and working with engineering and non-engineering partners.
  • Ability to translate technical concepts into languages that the audience (business stakeholders and engineering partners) with various levels of technical background can understand to influence decision making. 
    • Bonus if you have experience with:
  • Google G Suite APIs
  • Amazon Web Services
  • Building a relationship with the studio/marketing business users

6091da39aabfb4db2536fcc2.description:
Netflix has been changing the way people watch premium content. With over 200 million subscribers across the globe, we have been delivering joy one stream at a time on pretty much any connected device. Join us to help Netflix grow into the world's leading producer of premium content. 

The process of producing movies and TV shows is an industry that is ripe for technology innovation. We have an opportunity to transform how that’s done through building the most advanced content creation application suite in the entertainment industry.

Our studio business faces some truly unique challenges - e.g. evaluating which shows to produce, scheduling shoots based on unique talent schedules, creating compelling media to showcase our content.

The Studio UI Developer Productivity Team helps hundreds of developers in this effort by building frameworks, libraries, and best practices to help make developing enterprise-grade applications a cinch.

Who you are

  • Ability to hire and motivate a high-performing engineering team
  • You have real-world experience managing technical teams and shipping internal tools.
  • You are customer-focused, you view it as your responsibility to make sure the tools you build are widely adopted.
  • Strong communication skills with a passion for enhancing application quality

What can set you apart

  • Experience building and shipping workflow-based enterprise applications
  • First hand knowledge of the production process for movies and TV shows
  • You desire a fast-paced, dynamic environment

Why Netflix?

  • Big impact - Opportunity to revolutionize Hollywood’s studio business.
  • Rewarding - You get to work with stunning colleagues that help you grow and thrive
  • Unique culture - Our culture of Freedom and Responsibility help you remove red tape and drive change without processes

5ffce1dbaabfb41e5d9eb092.description:
It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to over 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We’ve become the largest entertainment studio in the world, creating new original content at an incredible pace. The Studio Innovation product team is front and center of this growth. We build software that fuels the production and creation of Netflix content. The Animation Studio Technology team within Studio Innovation builds products that power the Netflix Animation Studio ecosystem. Netflix is on a path to release six animation feature films per year, which no major studio has ever done, on top of the very healthy slate of animation series.
 
At Netflix, our animation product team is small so you have the opportunity to make a big impact, and our unique culture drives our approach to innovation. We’re seeking ambitious, analytical, and strategic leaders to join our team. You will hire the best engineering talent and will lead a team of engineers to identify new ways to create products that drive impact in Animation. You will collaborate with product, design, and data science leaders to set a vision and chart a course ahead. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways and the willingness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, a balance of creativity and analytic skills, and exceptional organizational leadership. The Animation team is growing at a rapid pace and needs a self-starter leader who has experience in strict prioritization and leveraging data to inform their decisions.

As UI engineering manager at Netflix, a typical day might include the following:

  • Having a 1-1 with an engineer on your team.  Building your relationship by getting to know them better, shining a spotlight on their clear communication with a partner, coaching them through a conflict and diving deeper into unlocking new ideas to accelerate developer productivity.
  • Preparing a discussion for your team meeting on topics ranging from empathy to execution.
  • Recruiting. Identifying and reaching out to UI engineering candidates who might strengthen your team by bringing a diverse perspective your team is currently lacking. Doing a phone screen with a candidate.  Prepping your interview team for an on-site interview.  
  • Leading a prioritization discussion with your product manager, backend engineering and design partners.  Recommending projects we might slow down on in favor of accelerating others so we can unlock more value for our customers.
  • Identifying risks, assigning ownership to engineers and clarifying what we are trying to achieve and next steps the team is accountable for. 
  • Partnering with product managers and data scientists to develop the metrics you’ll use to measure success of a new product initiative.  

What we are looking for:

  • Ability to build and motivate a diverse engineering organization to meet the needs of the Netflix Animation Studios
  • Someone with a proven track record leading large cross-functional engineering initiatives, while being a thought leader with PMs and Designers
  • Ability to work through ambiguous requirements and make decisions to push forward
  • A great communicator 
  • Someone with a passion for enhancing the quality of the products your team builds
  • Ability to work with stakeholders and tight-knit partners, many of them work out of the Animation Studio 
  • Ability to evaluate build vs. buy and licensing opportunities while balancing short term and long term perspectives
  • Ability to foster a learn-fast mentality and collaborate with operational teams to roll out products to our talent, employees, and partners.
  • Ability to work closely with data science and algorithm teams to generate insights and develop new ideas
  • Someone who thrives in a healthy debate of ideas while balancing to communicate your vision and strategy broadly throughout the organization

What Can Set You Apart

  • Experience building and shipping workflow-based enterprise applications
  • First-hand knowledge of the production process for animated movies and TV shows
  • You desire a fast-paced, dynamic environment

5f89243082ecd35a9e31a1ed.description:
The Company and Product Strategy: 
Instant streaming is a core part of Netflix's strategy for the future. Our first product to support instant streaming to TVs was launched in May 2008 and has since expanded to all relevant connected screens in the home, including TV’s, streaming sticks, and operator set-top boxes. Our reach and ease-of-use is enhanced through strong partnerships with many of the world's most innovative partners such as Sony, Panasonic, J:COM, and KDDI. In this role, you will help ensure we continue our strong innovation and partnership with our biggest partners in Japan.

About the role: 
In order to help our partners add the Netflix instant streaming service quickly to their device, we work very closely with these engineering teams to quickly overcome any and all challenges. We are looking to add to our team in APAC that currently works with local partners on integration, certification and in field phases of a product. You’ll apply your experience in software development to a wide variety of technical challenges to achieve the goal of helping our Japanese partners bring their products to market on time with the highest quality. The functionality of our platform includes streaming and playback, dynamic UI, payments, security and partner-specific adaptation for new types of devices. Willingness to travel to Netflix’s Los Gatos, CA headquarters to interface with the internal engineering teams, as well as periodic travel to Japan to develop and maintain strong ties with our partners. 

Our culture is a bit unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix at https://jobs.netflix.com/life-at-netflix

Required skills and attributes:

  • You are an experienced and current C/C++ programmer.
  • 5+ years of relevant experience integrating applications into complex embedded platforms.
  • You know what's important when releasing software to partners – ideally, you have worked as a software developer producing as well as consuming an SDK (Software Development Kit).
  • You're comfortable with proactive outward communication and technical leadership. 
  • You enjoy working side by side with partners on tough and ambiguous problems. Experience working with partners is a plus.
  • Ideally, you have a deep background in one or more of the following: embedded system development, Linux system-level programming, audio/video playback, embedded graphics, or UI programming. 
  • Experience with Android application and Android framework development is a plus.
  • 2-3 years experience as a team leader or an engineering manager is a plus.
  • Periodic travel to Los Gatos, California and regional offices required

607794c6b5811bf08f7dcdf2.description:
What you might not know about Netflix is just how much goes into building the world’s leading Internet TV network, and the technical innovation behind our storytelling. At the core of award winning content is our engineering team who imagines, creates, and delivers the technology that entertains the world.

As a recruiting team, we focus on finding great talent, anticipating business needs, and coaching our hiring partners to hire successfully. We don’t solely focus on metrics to determine a researcher’s success. Instead we also look at the qualitative impact in the form of coaching moments, successful long-term hires, and driving a forward-thinking streamlined recruiting strategy. We look for people who push the status quo, and enjoy spending their time finding smart and creative ways to source and attract talent. Our culture empowers people to think outside of the box, breaking the standard “recruiting process mold”. You will be empowered to be innovative when you think a process is inefficient and you’ll have peers who do the same.

 In this role, you will lead a team of researchers who are responsible for  identifying, engaging and attracting top engineering talent that is key to the growth, success, and innovation of Netflix. In order to do this successfully it will require a high degree of influencing, critical thinking and strong collaboration with your team, engineering leadership and your colleagues on the talent acquisition team. 

In this role, you will:

  • Hire and lead the industry’s best technical sourcers with compassion and with a global mindset 
  • Be a critical inclusion & diversity thought partner to your team and engineering leaders. Determine a plan for increasing representation within engineering 
  • Coach and advise your team as they partner with hiring managers and recruiters to develop strategies for attracting engineering talent 
  • Understand how to best use qualitative and quantitative data to influence decisions and continuously improve our overall effectiveness
  • Help engineering scale sourcing and interviewing efforts to become more efficient while also preserving aspects of hiring that lead to strong candidate experience and high offer acceptance rates 

Preferred Qualifications:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years leading sourcing teams with 5+ years experience in technical sourcing
  • You have experience using sourcing tools and applicant tracking systems to identify and engage passive, qualified candidates and manage them through the hiring process
  • You have the ability to lead with empathy and compassion while setting a high bar for performance
  • You are fluent  with data and eager to get creative and curious about metrics that highlight opportunity
  • You have sourced and led teams through change and scale 
  • Experience working with both centralized and decentralized sourcing models

6014c25baabfb4f1d8882a3c.description:
Netflix has been changing the way people watch shows and movies. We strive to deliver a great Netflix viewing experience in over 190 countries so our customers can watch whatever, whenever, interruption free. Join us to help Netflix grow into the world's leading producer of premium content. Our Offices and Creative Spaces network engineering team designs, builds and operates networks to connect our internal users, creatives, production teams and partners around the world. We are looking for a Technical Project Manager that can own the successful execution of multiple build and deployment initiatives in parallel as we scale and expand our footprint around the globe. You will leverage your technical expertise and experiences, develop an understanding of Netflix and our customer and internal partner needs, and with your peers execute to deliver network connectivity and services to our users and offices around the world. 

Job Description

  • Partner with engineers, business and technical leaders, and real estate partners from internal and external teams to deliver networks to Netflix creative and business users
  • Work cross-functionally with internal teams and external vendors to plan and manage our growth around the globe
  • Own and maintain our backlog of network build and deployment projects globally 
  • Maintain and evolve milestones and a project framework to ensure timelines and deliverables are met
  • Socialize project timelines and maintain accountability on deliverables
  • Apply an understanding of networks, facility construction and build-out, as well as project management within the domain of network infrastructure deployment, engineering and operations
  • Work with VARs to manage logistic pipelines for network deployments
  • Work with VARs for asset management and licensing renewals
  • Work with management on FP&A for enterprise networking spend

Professional Qualifications

  • At least 5 years of relevant professional experience
  • Experience managing and working with engineering teams collectively
  • Sharp assessment skills with an ability to evaluate wants vs. needs and ability to negotiate prioritization accordingly
  • Knowledge of facilities construction planning and program management
  • Experience in asset tracking, asset management, and general logistics
  • Understanding of networking technologies, roles, functions and basic capabilities

Organizational Qualifications

  • Self organize, participate in cross-functional projects with our partners  
  • See a problem or opportunity, take ownership and act on it independently
  • Collaborate and manage efforts with peers and teams across responsibility areas, languages, geography and time zones
  • Be a self-starter, curious and not afraid to ask when in doubt
  • Clearly communicate status on project milestones, risks, blockers to critical path items and hold team members accountable for deliverables

Additional Requirements

  • Occasional travel
  • Experience working in media and studio environments is a plus
